DOC.brief_title: Study Comparing Soybean Oil-Based With Olive Oil-Based Lipid Emulsion Intensive Care Unit Patients
DOC.detailed_description: This study compare effect soybean oil-based versus olive oil-based lipid emulsion healthy volunteer critically ill patient . In healthy volunteer , blood sugar level , blood vessel function , ability fight infection examine . In ICU patient , examines whether use olive oil-based lipid emulsion may decrease risk infection hospital complication .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : Age : 18 80 year initiate PN In medical/surgical ICU Has central venous access administer PN Anticipated receive PN ≥ 5 day Exclusion criterion : Enrolled investigative study within last 30 day prior study entry Female patient : pregnant breast feeding Has clinical sepsis ( define mean arterial pressure ( MAP ) < 60 mmHg ≥ 2 occasion unstable BP despite pressor support ) within 24 hour prior study entry Has know cirrhosis total bilirubin ≥ 10.0 mg/dL Has chronic renal failure ( defined requirement hemodialysis peritoneal dialysis therapy ) , creatinine ≥ 3.5 mg/dL without CRRT , require acute postoperative dialysis Has active malignancy ( define require chemotherapy , radiation , and/or surgical intervention within 90 day prior study entry ) ( exclude nonmelanoma skin cancer ) Has know AIDS Has terminal illness ( life expectancy < 7 day ) Has undergo organ transplantation Has receive PN lipid within 48 hour prior study entry Has mental disability understand scope possible consequence study legally authorize representative unavailable Has baseline serum triglyceride > 400 mg/dL
